parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is called.
Address of the variable where the cloned object will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the object could be cloned, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Notify the object that it can/should call its sink's GG_DataSink_PutData method again.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

detaileddescription.para: Put data to a sink. If the data is accepted, the caller may release its reference to the data passed in, since the sink will retain its own references if needed.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
The data to put.
Optional metadata (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the data was accepted by the sink, GG_ERROR_WOULD_BLOCK if the sink would normally accept the data, but cannot do so at this time, in which case the caller should retry at a later time.

detaileddescription.para: Set a sink's listener. The listener is called when it is appropriate to call GG_DataSink_PutData after a return value equal to GG_ERROR_WOULD_BLOCK

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
The listener for the sink.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the operation succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Set the sink to which this source will send data.

NOTE: the lifetime of the sink passed to this method must be the same or longer than that of this object. Therefore, if that sink must be destroyed earlier than this object, the caller MUST call this method again with a NULL (or other sink) before destroying it.

NOTE: objects that implement this method typically call the sink's GG_DataSink::SetListener method to register themselves as a listener. In that case, the object MUST keep a reference to the sink so it can de-register itself by calling GG_DataSink::SetListener(_, NULL) prior to registering itself to a different sink and/or in its destructor.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
The sink that will receive data from this object when available.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the operation succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Retain a reference to this object.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: The retained object (which may or may not be the same pointer as the one on which this method is called).

detaileddescription.para: Release a reference to this object.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

detaileddescription.para: Read data.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Buffer in which the data should be read.
Maximum number of bytes to read.
Pointer to the variable in which the number of bytes read will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if at least one byte was read, GG_ERROR_EOS if the end of the stream has been reached, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Change the current stream position, relative to the start of the stream.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Position to which to seek.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the operation succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current stream position, relative to the start of the stream.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to a variable in which the position will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the operation succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Get the size of the stream.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to a variable in which the size will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the operation succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Get the amount of data that can be read from the stream, from the current position.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to a variable in which the number of bytes available to read will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the operation succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Read from a stream one line at a time, into a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Buffer in which the line will be read.
Size of the buffer.
Pointer to a variable in which the number of line characters have been read.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if a line was read, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Read from a stream one line at a time, into a string object.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
GG_String object that will receive the line.
Maximum line size to accept.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if a line was read, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Read a 64-bit integer, in Big Endian byte order.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to the variable in which the integer will be stored.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if a value was read, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Read a 32-bit integer, in Big Endian byte order.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to the variable in which the integer will be stored.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if a value was read, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Read a 16-bit integer, in Big Endian byte order.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to the variable in which the integer will be stored.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if a value was read, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Read a fixed amount of data.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Buffer in which the data will be read.
Number of bytes to read.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if exactly bytes_to_read bytes were read, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Skip some data from the current position.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Number of bytes to skip.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the call succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Read data into a GG_DynamicBuffer buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Maximum number of bytes to read, or 0 to read until the end of the stream.
Pointer to a variable in which a GG_DynamicBuffer instance will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the call succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Retain a reference to this object.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: The retained object (which may or may not be the same pointer as the one on which this method is called).

detaileddescription.para: Retain a reference to this object.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: The retained object (which may or may not be the same pointer as the one on which this method is called).

detaileddescription.para: Write data.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Data to write.
Maximum number of bytes to write.
Pointer to a variable in which the number of bytes written is returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if at least one byte could be written, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Change the current stream position, relative to the start of the stream.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Position to which to seek.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the operation succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current stream position, relative to the start of the stream.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to a variable in which the position will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the operation succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Flush any pending/cached data.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the operation succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Write a fixed amount of data.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Data to write.
Number of bytes to write.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if exactly bytes_to_write bytes were written, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Write a NULL-terminated string (the NULL termination is not written).

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
The string to write.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the entire string was written, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Write a NULL-terminated string followed by \r\n (the NULL termination is not written).

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
The line to write.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the entire line was written, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Create a new instance of GG_MemoryStream. The object starts with a data size of 0. Writing to the GG_OutputStream interface will attempt to grow the data buffer held by the object.

parameterdescription.para: The initial size of the memory buffer managed by the object.
Pointer to a variable where the object will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the object could be created, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Create a new instance of GG_MemoryStream. The object starts with the supplied data, provided as an external buffer, which must remain allocated during the lifetime of this object. Writing to the GG_OutputStream interface will not attempt to grow the data buffer held by the object.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to which this object provides a view.
The size of buffer.
Pointer to a variable where the object will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the object could be created, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the internal GG_DynamicBuffer object that represents the data managed by this object.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to a variable where the internal buffer object will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the call succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the GG_InputStream interface for this object. NOTE: the caller must call GG_InputStream_Release on the interface obtained from this call when it is done with it.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to a variable where the GG_InputStream interface will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the call succeeded, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the GG_OutputStream interface for this object. NOTE: the caller must call GG_OutputStream_Release on the interface obtained from this call when it is done with it.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
Pointer to a variable where the GG_OutputStream interface will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the call succeeded, or an error code.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a GG_BufferMetadata struct given its type ID and C type.

detaileddescription.para: The type ID passed here is the tail of the C constant name for the type ID that follows the GG_BUFFER_METADATA_TYPE_ prefix. So for example, to initialize a metadata struct that has the C type FooBar and the type ID constant GG_BUFFER_METADATA_TYPE_FOOBAR, you would use GG_BUFFER_METADATA_INITIALIZER(FOOBAR, Foobar)
General Purpose I/O Interfaces, Classes and Functions
